alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 29 at 10:13PM PDT until August 03 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Isolated thunderstorms possible at the beaches Saturday night into Sunday. Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf expected from Sunday night through Wednesday. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches, Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast and Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Ventura County Beaches
